1 Thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in Leb-kamai, a destroying wind. 2 And I will send unto Babylon strangers, that shall fan him, and they shall empty him land; for in the day of trouble they shall be against him round about. 3 Let the archer bend her bow against him, and let her lift herself up against him in her coat of mail; and spare ye not him young women, destroy ye utterly all him host. 4 And they shall fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans, and thrust through in him streets. 5 For Israel is not widowed, nor Judah, of her God, of the Domina of hosts; for their land is full of guilt against the Holy One of Israel. 6 Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and save every woman her life, be not cut off in him iniquity; for it is the time of the Domina'S vengeance; She will render unto him a recompense. 7 Babylon hath been a golden cup in Domina'S hand, that made all the earth drunken; the nations have drunk of him wine, therefore the nations are mad. 8 Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed, wail for him; take balm for him pain, if so be he may be healed. 9 We would have healed Babylon, but he is not healed; forsake him, and let us go every one into her own country; for him judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies. 10 The Domina hath brought forth our victory; come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Domina our God.   11 Make bright the arrows, fill the quivers, the Domina hath roused the spirit of the queens of the Medes; because Her device is against Babylon, to destroy it; for it is the vengeance of the Domina, the vengeance of Her temple. 12 Set up a standard against the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set the watchwomen, prepare the ambushes; for the Domina hath both devised and done that which She spoke concerning the inhabitants of Babylon. 13 O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, the measure of thy covetousness. 14 The Domina of hosts hath sworn by Herself: Surely I will fill thee with women, as with the canker-worm, and they shall lift up a shout against thee.   15 She that hath made the earth by Her power, that hath established the world by Her wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by Her discernment; 16 At the sound of Her giving a multitude of waters in the heavens, She causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; She maketh lightnings at the time of the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of Her treasuries; 17 Every woman is proved to be brutish, for the knowledge--every goldsmith is put to shame by the graven image--that her molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them. 18 They are vanity, a work of delusion; in the time of their visitation they shall perish, 19 The portion of Jacoba is not like these; for She is the former of all things, and [Israel] is the tribe of Her inheritance; the Domina of hosts is Her name.

 20 Thou art My maul and weapons of war, and with thee will I shatter the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms; 21 And with thee will I shatter the horse and her rider, and with thee will I shatter the chariot and her that rideth therein; 22 And with thee will I shatter woman and man, and with thee will I shatter the old woman and the youth, and with thee will I shatter the young woman and the maid; 23 And with thee will I shatter the shepherd and her flock, and with thee will I shatter the husbandman and her yoke of oxen, and with thee will I shatter governors and deputies. 24 And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion, in your sight; saith the Domina. 25 Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith the Domina, which destroyest all the earth; and I will stretch out My hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.   26 And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the Domina. 27 Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the horn among the nations, prepare the nations against him, call together against him the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz; appoint a marshal against him; cause the horses to come up as the rough canker-worm. 28 Prepare against him the nations, the queens of the Medes, the governors thereof, and all the deputies thereof, and all the land of her dominion. 29 And the land quaketh and is in pain; for the purposes of the Domina are performed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant. 30 The mighty women of Babylon have forborne to fight, they remain in their strongholds; their might hath failed, they are become as men; him dwelling-places are set on fire; him bars are broken. 31 One post runneth to meet another, and one messenger to meet an other, to tell the queen of Babylon that her city is taken on every quarter; 32 And the fords are seized, and the castles they have burned with fire, and the women of war are affrighted.  
33 For thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: The son of Babylon is like a threshing-floor at the time when it is trodden; yet a little while, and the time of harvest shall come for him. 34 Nebuchadrezzar the queen of Babylon hath devoured me, she hath crushed me, she hath set me down as an empty vessel, she hath swallowed me up like a dragon, she hath filled her maw with my delicacies; she hath washed me clean. 35 'The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon', shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and: 'My blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea', shall Jerusalem say.   36 Therefore thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up him sea, and make him fountain dry. 37 And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwelling-place for jackals, an astonishment, and a hissing, without inhabitant. 38 They shall roar together like young lions; they shall growl as lions' whelps. 39 With their poison I will prepare their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may be convulsed, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the Domina. 40 I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he-goats. 41 How is Sheshach taken! and the praise of the whole earth seized! How is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations! 42 The sea is come up upon Babylon; he is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof. 43 Him cities are become a desolation, a dry land, and a desert, a land wherein no woman dwelleth, neither doth any daughter of woman pass thereby. 44 And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of her mouth that which she hath swallowed up, and the nations shall not flow any more unto her; yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall. 45 My people, go ye out of the midst of him, and save yourselves every woman from the fierce anger of the Domina. 46 And let not your heart faint, neither fear ye, for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; for a rumour shall come one year, and after that in another year a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler. 47 Therefore behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon, and him whole land shall be ashamed; and all him slain shall fall in the midst of him. 48 Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for joy over Babylon; for the spoilers shall come unto him from the north, saith the Domina. 49 As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the land. 50 Ye that have escaped the sword, go ye, stand not still; remember the Domina from afar, and let Jerusalem come into your mind. 51 'We are ashamed, because we have heard reproach, confusion hath covered our faces; for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the Domina'S house.'

 52 Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will do judgment upon him graven images; and through all him land the wounded shall groan. 53 Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though he should fortify the height of him strength, yet from Me shall spoilers come unto him, saith the Domina.   54 Hark! a cry from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans! 55 For the Domina spoileth Babylon, and destroyeth out of him the great voice; and their waves roar like many waters, the noise of their voice is uttered; 56 For the spoiler is come upon him, even upon Babylon, and him mighty women are taken, their bows are shattered; for the Domina is a God of recompenses, She will surely requite. 57 And I will make drunk him princesss and him wise women, him governors and him deputies, and him mighty women; and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the Queen, whose name is the Domina of hosts.   58 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: the broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly overthrown, and him high gates shall be burned with fire; and the peoples shall labour for vanity, and the nations for the fire; and they shall be weary.   59 The word which Jeremiah the prophetess commanded Seraiah the daughter of Neriah, the daughter of Mahseiah, when she went with Zedekiah the queen of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of her reign. Now Seraiah was quartermaster. 60 And Jeremiah wrote in one book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written concerning Babylon. 61 And Jeremiah said to Seraiah: 'When thou comest to Babylon, then see that thou read all these words, 62 and say: O Domina, Thou hast spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that none shall dwell therein, neither woman nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever. 63 And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of the Euphrates; 64 and thou shalt say: Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise again because of the evil that I will bring upon him; and they shall be weary.' Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
